article_title: Los Angeles Neighborhoods Tackle Homelessness on Their Own
article_text:
LOS ANGELES—As dusk became night in this city’s posh Pacific Palisades neighborhood, Patrick Hart stepped out of his BMW and walked into a neighborhood park in search of Bobby Foster, a 58-year-old homeless man who sleeps in a grove.

For about a year, Mr. Hart, a resident of the coastal enclave, has been voluntarily checking in on Mr. Foster and other homeless, as the number of people living without shelter here has grown. Next year,...

twitter.description: Los Angeles neighborhoods tackle homelessness on their own, with private efforts aiming to curb outdoor encampments that have spread from downtown’s Skid Row to residential areas.
twitter.title: Los Angeles Neighborhoods Tackle Homelessness on Their Own
